intro: Psychotria lanaensis, commonly known as the Lanae's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria lanaensis is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
